intro: Triumfetta welwitschii var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. The species is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
